title: Linda Robson is returning to Loose Women after taking a break for 'family problems'
text:

Linda Robson has revealed that after a tough personal time she is returning to Loose Women.

She has been off air since January when police and medics were reportedly called to her house twice in two weeks.

Linda said: “I’m coming back to Loose Women. I had a little break, we had a few problems in the family, but I’m fine.”

The Birds of a Feather actress, 61, added a family member had been ill.

Linda, who has previously spoken about battling anxiety, was said to have struggled over the festive season.

She has now said she is looking forward to returning to the Loose Women panel soon.

Referring to the other celebs on the ITV chat show, which recently marked its 20th anniversary, she added she cannot wait for “the gossip in the green room and our little chats”.

She said: “That’s my favourite part – things you never see on air.”

(Image: ITV)

An ITV source said it is hoped Linda will be back next year and the prospect of her making a return is cause for celebration.

The insider said: “She is so well loved by viewers and the Loose Women that her place on the panel is always available. It would be great to have her back.

“She’s a lovely woman who will always be part of the ITV family.”

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX/Shutterstock)

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX/Shutterstock)

Linda, has two children, Louis and Roberta, with her husband Mark Dunford, 58. She also has a daughter, Lauren, from an earlier relationship.

Linda talked last week about a bizarre situation in which she became godmother to two children she had never met before.

She said that as she made her way to the loo in a church in Dublin after Mass a family recognised her and asked if she would accept taking on the role.

Linda added: “I said ‘yes’ but I had jeans on and was all scruffy. I had 20 euros so I said ‘will you get my godchildren a little present with that?’.

“I’ll have to send them gifts every year. It was just for fun but the family said they were honoured. We had a nice time over there.”

She recently lost more than 2st after ditching booze and sugar. She previously said she drank a bottle of wine a night.

Linda, a former I’m a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here! contestant, admitted: “I didn’t have a problem but... it could have easily turned into one.”
